Wisdom is also represented by the sense of justice of the lawful and wise king [[Solomon]], who asks God for wisdom in [[1 Kings]] 3. In the [[Christianity|Christian]] [[Bible]] and [[Judaism|Jewish]] scripture, Wisdom is also represented by the sense of justice of the lawful and wise king [[Solomon]], who asks God for wisdom in [[1 Kings]] 3. [[Book of Proverbs|Proverbs]] 9:10 says: "The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom," (Proverbs 1:7) and 8:13 "To fear the Lord is to hate evil;".
     
There is an oppositional element in Christian thought between [[secular]] wisdom and Godly wisdom. The [[apostle Paul]] states that worldly wisdom thinks the claims of [[Christ]] to be foolishness. However, to those who are being saved Christ represents the wisdom of God. ([[1 Corinthians]] 1:17-31) Also, Wisdom is one of the [[Seven gifts of the Holy Spirit]].
